CreateMediaLiveChannel.document: This API is used to create a media channel.
CreateMediaLiveChannel.name: Creates media channel

CreateMediaLiveInput.document: This API is used to create a media input.
CreateMediaLiveInput.name: Creates media input

CreateMediaLiveInputSecurityGroup.document: This API is used to create an input security group. Up to 5 ones can be created.
CreateMediaLiveInputSecurityGroup.name: Creates input security group

DeleteMediaLiveChannel.document: This API is used to delete a MediaLive channel.
DeleteMediaLiveChannel.name: Deletes MediaLive channel

DeleteMediaLiveInput.document: This API is used to delete a media input.
DeleteMediaLiveInput.name: Deletes media input

DeleteMediaLiveInputSecurityGroup.document: This API is used to delete an input security group.
DeleteMediaLiveInputSecurityGroup.name: Deletes input security group

DescribeMediaLiveChannel.document: This API is used to query the information of a MediaLive channel.
DescribeMediaLiveChannel.name: Queries MediaLive channel

DescribeMediaLiveChannelAlerts.document: This API is used to query the channel alarm information.
DescribeMediaLiveChannelAlerts.name: Queries channel alarm information

DescribeMediaLiveChannelInputStatistics.document: This API is used to query the input statistics.
DescribeMediaLiveChannelInputStatistics.name: Queries input statistics

DescribeMediaLiveChannelLogs.document: This API is used to query MediaLive channel logs, such as push event logs.
DescribeMediaLiveChannelLogs.name: Queries MediaLive channel logs

DescribeMediaLiveChannelOutputStatistics.document: This API is used to query the output statistics of a channel.
DescribeMediaLiveChannelOutputStatistics.name: Queries the output statistics of a channel

DescribeMediaLiveChannels.document: This API is used to query the information of MediaLive channels in batches.
DescribeMediaLiveChannels.name: Queries MediaLive channels in batches

DescribeMediaLiveInput.document: This API is used to query a media input.
DescribeMediaLiveInput.name: Queries media input.

DescribeMediaLiveInputSecurityGroup.document: This API is used to query an input security group.
DescribeMediaLiveInputSecurityGroup.name: Queries input security group

DescribeMediaLiveInputSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the information of input security groups in batches.
DescribeMediaLiveInputSecurityGroups.name: Queries the information of input security groups in batches

DescribeMediaLiveInputs.document: This API is used to query the information of media inputs in batches.
DescribeMediaLiveInputs.name: Queries the information of media inputs in batches

ModifyMediaLiveChannel.document: This API is used to modify the information of a MediaLive channel.
ModifyMediaLiveChannel.name: Modifies MediaLive channel

ModifyMediaLiveInput.document: This API is used to update a media input.
ModifyMediaLiveInput.name: Updates media input

ModifyMediaLiveInputSecurityGroup.document: This API is used to update an input security group.
ModifyMediaLiveInputSecurityGroup.name: Updates input security group

StartMediaLiveChannel.document: This API is used to start a MediaLive channel.
StartMediaLiveChannel.name: Starts MediaLive channel

StopMediaLiveChannel.document: This API is used to stop a MediaLive channel.
StopMediaLiveChannel.name: Stops MediaLive channel

AttachedInputInfo.document: Media input associated with media channel.

members.document: Relay destination address. Length limit: [1,512].
members.name: OutputUrl

members.document:
Authentication key. Length limit: [1,128].
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: AuthKey

members.document:
Authentication username. Length limit: [1,128].
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Username

members.document:
Authentication password. Length limit: [1,128].
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Password

members.document:
DRM key, which is a 32-bit hexadecimal string.
Note: uppercase letters in the string will be automatically converted to lowercase ones.
members.name: Key

members.document:
Required for Widevine encryption. Valid values: SD, HD, UHD1, UHD2, AUDIO, ALL.
ALL refers to all tracks. If this parameter is set to ALL, no other tracks can be added.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Track

members.document:
Required for Widevine encryption. It is a 32-bit hexadecimal string.
Note: uppercase letters in the string will be automatically converted to lowercase ones.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: KeyId

members.document:
Required when FairPlay uses the AES encryption method. It is a 32-bit hexadecimal string.
For more information about this parameter, please see: 
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3826
Note: uppercase letters in the string will be automatically converted to lowercase ones.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Iv

DrmSettingsInfo.document: DRM configuration information, which takes effect only for HLS and DASH.

members.document:
Whether to enable DRM encryption. Valid value: CLOSE/OPEN. Default value: CLOSE.
Currently, this is supported only for HLS/DASH/HLS_ARCHIVE/DASH_ARCHIVE.
members.name: State

members.document:
When `Scheme` is set to TencentDRM, this parameter should be set to the `ContentId` of DRM encryption, and if this parameter is left empty, a `ContentId` will be automatically created. For more information, please see [here](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/1000/40960?from_cn_redirect=1).
When `Scheme` is set to CustomDRMKeys, this parameter is required and should be specified by the user.
members.name: ContentId

members.document:
Valid values: TencentDRM, CustomDRMKeys. If this parameter is left empty, TencentDRM will be used by default.
TencentDRM refers to Tencent digital rights management (DRM) encryption. For more information, please see [here](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/solution/drm?from_cn_redirect=1).
CustomDRMKeys refers to an encryption key customized by the user.
members.name: Scheme

members.document:
The key customized by the content user, which is required when `Scheme` is set to CustomDRMKeys.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Keys

members.document: Segment duration in ms. Value range: [1000,30000]. Default value: 4000. The value can only be a multiple of 1,000.
members.name: SegmentDuration

members.document: Number of segments. Value range: [1,30]. Default value: 5.
members.name: SegmentNumber

members.document: Whether to enable PDT insertion. Valid values: CLOSE/OPEN. Default value: CLOSE.
members.name: PdtInsertion

members.document: PDT duration in seconds. Value range: (0,3000]. Default value: 600.
members.name: PdtDuration

Stream name, which is used for RTMP_PUSH and can contain 1-32 letters and digits.

Origin-pull URL, which is used for RTMP_PULL/HLS_PULL/MP4_PULL. Length limit: [1,512].
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

RTP/UDP input address, which does not need to be entered for the input parameter.

Log type.
It contains the value of `StreamStart` which refers to the push information.

members.document: Media packaging ID.

members.document: Channel ID.
members.name: Id

members.document:
Input settings information.
One or two sets of settings need to be configured for RTMP_PUSH/RTMP_PULL/HLS_PULL/MP4_PULL.
This parameter can be left empty for RTP_PUSH and UDP_PUSH.
Note: if it is left empty or the array is empty, the original `InputSettings` value will be used.

members.document: Video bitrate. Value range: [50000,40000000]. The value can only be a multiple of 1,000. If this parameter is left empty, the original value will be used.
members.name: VideoBitrate

members.document: Video width. Value range: (0,3000]. The value can only be a multiple of 4. If this parameter is left empty, the original value will be used.
members.name: Width

members.document: Video height. Value range: (0,3000]. The value can only be a multiple of 4. If this parameter is left empty, the original value will be used.
members.name: Height

members.document: Video frame rate. Value range: [1,240]. If this parameter is left empty, the original value will be used.
members.name: Fps

members.document: Whether to enable top speed codec. Valid value: CLOSE/OPEN. Default value: CLOSE.
members.name: TopSpeed

members.document: Top speed codec compression ratio. Value range: [0,50]. The lower the compression ratio, the higher the image quality.
members.name: BitrateCompressionRatio
